intro: Anemia anthriscifolia var. simplicior, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and meadows. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clustered umbels, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
